text:
In the 'org.apache.batik.svggen.ImageHandlerBase64Encoder' class 'handleHREF'
method line 70 there is a call to 'Graphics2D' class 'drawImage' method:

g.drawImage(image, 0, 0, null);

This call does not use an ImageObserver, and therefore it does not handle
properly the cases where the source image is still under construction at the
time of the method call. The result may be incomplete/missing image data.

An obvious fix would be to use an appropriate ImageObserver, although as always
when working with Image objects, implementing one may not be trivial.
creator: rami.hanninen@davisor.com

text:
Unless you can provide a compelling argument to the contrary
my feeling is that it is the callers responsability to ensure
that the image drawn to the Graphics has been fully loaded.

This is the approach every other implementation of Graphics2D
seems to take.
